topic.title: HPE Helion OpenStack 2.0 Multiple External Network Configuration

body.p: HPE Helion OpenStack 2.0 Multiple External Network Configuration
This document describes the configuration process and requirements for the HPE Helion OpenStack 2.0 Multiple External Network.

section.title: Prerequisites
section.p: HPE Helion OpenStack must be installed.

section.title: Configuration
section.p: HPE Helion OpenStack 2.0 Multiple External Network Configuration
Neutron provider VLANs are neutron networks that map directly to an 802.1Q VLAN in the cloud providerâ€™s physical network infrastructure. There are four aspects to provider vlan configuration:

ul.li: Network infrastructure configuration (e.g. the top-of-rack switch)
Server networking configuration (for compute nodes and neutron network nodes)
Create the corresponding network objects in Neutron

section.p: The physical network infrastructure must be configured to convey the provider VLAN traffic as tagged VLANs to the cloud compute nodes and neutron network nodes. Configuration of the physical network infrastructure is outside the scope of the HPE Helion OpenStack 2.0 software.

HPE Helion OpenStack 2.0 automates the server networking configuration and the Neutron configuration based on information in the cloud definition. To configure the system for provider VLANs, specify the neutron.networks.vlan tag with a provider-physical-network attribute on one or more network groups. For example (some attributes omitted for brevity):
section.codeblock:
network-groups:
- name: NET_GROUP_A tags: - neutron.networks.vlan: provider-physical-network: physnet1
- name: NET_GROUP_B tags: - neutron.networks.vlan: provider-physical-network: physnet2
section.p: A network group is associated with a server network interface via an interface model. For example (some attributes omitted for brevity):
section.codeblock: interface-models: - name: INTERFACE_SET_X network-interfaces: - device: name: bond0 network-groups: - NET_GROUP_A - device: name: eth3 network-groups: - NET_GROUP_B
section.p: A network group used for provider VLANs may contain only a single HOS network, because that VLAN must span all compute nodes and any neutron network nodes/controllers (i.e. it is a single L2 segment). The HOS network must be defined with tagged-vlan false, otherwise a linux vlan network interface will be created. For example:
section.codeblock:
networks:
- name: NET_A tagged-vlan: false network-group: NET_GROUP_A
- name: NET_B tagged-vlan: false network-group: NET_GROUP_B
section.p: When the cloud is deployed, HPE Helion OpenStack 2.0 will create the appropriate bridges on the servers, and set the appropriate attributes in the Neutron configuration files (e.g. bridge_mappings).
After the cloud has been deployed, create Neutron network objects for each provider VLAN. For example, using the Neutron CLI:
section.codeblock: neutron net-create --provider:network_type vlan --provider:physical_network physnet1 --provider:segmentation_id 101 mynet101 neutron net-create --provider:network_type vlan --provider:physical_network physnet2 --provider:segmentation_id 234 mynet234
